86227.release_notes:
Release Notes: v1.0.2

🎉 We're excited to introduce Unicons Figma Plugin version 1.0.2! This update brings a host of new features and enhancements to elevate your design experience. Here's what's new:

New Features:

1. 4 Native Styles: Explore a diverse range of design styles with the addition of 4 new native styles - Line, Solid, Thin Line, and Monochrome. These styles offer increased flexibility and creativity for your projects, empowering you to bring your ideas to life with precision and flair.

2. Authentication: Enjoy a seamless and secure user experience with the introduction of authentication to the Unicons Figma Plugin. Authenticate your account effortlessly to unlock access to premium features and personalized content tailored to your needs.

3. Upgrade to Unicons Pro: Elevate your design toolkit with Unicons Pro, now available as part of the Unicons Figma Plugin. Unlock a wealth of premium icons, resources, and exclusive benefits to enhance your design workflow and unleash your creativity like never before.

Your feedback is instrumental in shaping the future of Unicons Figma Plugin. Have ideas for new features or encountered any issues? Reach out to our support team—we're here to listen and assist you every step of the way.

Thank you for your continued support. We hope you enjoy the latest enhancements in Unicons Figma Plugin version 1.0.2!

Happy designing!

plugins.name: Really Flatten Vectors
plugins.description: Figma plugin that flattens a vector into as few paths as possible. Overlapping paths will be simplified so only the outer shape is defined. The flattening happens in-place.UsageSelect some layersRun the plugin by going to Plugins > Really Flatten Vectors or pressing ⌘/ and searching for Really Flatten Vectors.LinksGitHubPersonal SiteKnown IssuesFlattening inside of a group/frame with auto-layout will not flatten in-placeSome invisible layers will be made visibleHow does it work?Generally, Figma simplifies paths when using the built-in flatten ⌘E on a union layer. This plugin simplifies the setup needed to get a pretty flattened output.Deeply ungroup/unframe the selection. This keeps positioning simple for some of the later operations.Outline all strokes. Since this plugin merges everything into one path, strokes cannot be preserved. All strokes and text are outlined.Use the first valid fill paint data to use as the output fill.Use Figma's built-in flatten to merge the layers. Figma is pretty intelligent and will place the resulting layer in the correct spot in the layer hierarchy.Create a union layer that contains the resulting layer from the previous step, and a clone of that same layer. This is because running the built-in flatten on a union with just one layer won't simplify the paths. If there is an exact replica inside the union, then the resulting layer will have simplified paths.Run the built-in flatten against the union.

accepted.name: steven la
accepted.description: Engineering @figmadesign

plugins.description: Bulk desaturate frames, groups and image fills in one click.UsageSelect the layers you want to desaturate and run the appropriate menu option - Frames & Groups or Image Fills.When desaturating image fills, the plugin automatically desaturates all image fills in any children layers in your selected layers.ShortcutsAfter running the plugin once, use the "Run Last Plugin" shortcut (⌥⌘P / Alt + Ctrl + P) to run the plugin rapidly.To undo desaturation, use the undo shortcut (⌘Z / Ctrl + Z) like usual.Privacy & Network AccessDesaturate is completely private. plugins.name: Chromatic Figma
plugins.description:
Chromatic Figma lets you use other color spaces than RGB, such as Lab and Lch, to create good-looking and perceptually uniform gradients and color scales. Those are color spaces that, unlike RGB, was created to mirror the visual response of the human eye. That makes them very well suited for interpolating colors, and often produces more natural looking and aesthetically pleasing results.

Usage

Chromatic Figma -> Fix Gradient
This command will take the gradient of the selected shape and add new color stops to create a (in many cases) more aesthetically pleasing one.

Chromatic Figma -> Create Color Scale
This command will create a customizable scale between the fill colors of two selected shapes (or colors chosen using color pickers in the popup)

plugins.name: figma2html
plugins.description:
Export Figma frames to responsive HTML and CSS. A Figma version of ai2html, with additional features. Created by The DataFace.Learn more about this plugin on GitHub.Instructions1. Create your artworkSize frames according to the desired breakpoints. (note: breakpoints are based on width and not height).Name frames using the following format: #[width]px (e.g. #640px).If you're using a Google Font that's built in to Figma, you'll have the option to automatically include the appropriate Google Fonts tag in your exported HTML. Otherwise, you can add your webfonts to your project yourself or include a custom script or link any custom CSS in the Page settings panel.'2. Run the plugin and configure your settingsIn the plugin dialog, you can you load your preconfigured settings from a YAML text node named f2h-settings on the current page in your Figma doc, or you can write your current settings to a YAML text node.3. Click Export and voila, you can save your exported images and HTML file as a zipped folder.How it WorksThe plugin grabs all frames named #[width]px on your current page, unframes all children (turns frames into groups to get positions relative to the parent frame), hides all text layers, and exports as a PNG, JPG, or SVG, at a specified scale.All text elements are added via absolutely positioned divs.Text is rendered as 

 (or header) elements. A style is applied based on the most frequently used style within that frame, with inline styles applied to text that differs. This should match what you see in Figma.Text frames with auto widths are rendered with width=auto, while text frames with set widths include that width as inline css.Text is rendered with any visible drop shadows and layer blurs as inline css.The plugin supports rotated text, as well as left/right/center-aligned text.If Include Resizer Script is turned on, the outputted HTML will include JS to show and hide the correct image at the appropriate size, based on the named width of the frame.Contributing + FeedbackWe welcome feedback, bug reports and feature requests in the form of GitHub Issues or PRs. Alternatively, comments can be left on the Figma plugin community page.Further information on contributing can be found in CONTRIBUTING.md.AcknowledgementsFigma2html is not possible without ai2html, created by Archie Tse at The New York Times. Figma2html sprung from the same codebase, modified in time to add additional features specific to the Figma API. The plugin was inspired by Thomas Lowry's Figma Plugin DS Svelte library.The core team from The DataFace features Sam Vickars, Sawyer Click, and Michael Hester.

accepted.name: The DataFace
accepted.description: A digital agency, specializing in data visualization

plugins.tagline: Export Figma frames as images with text elements rendered as HTML

plugins.name: GridMod | Modify GridGen Tables Effortlessly
plugins.description:
How-To Use:
• Select the parent group of the table and launch the plugin
   ‣ Plugin is capable of detecting if a valid GridGen table is selected
   ‣ If selection is changed mid-way through plugin utilization, the last selected table is remembered
• GridMod is capable of modifying:
   ‣ The width or height of all columns/rows
   ‣ The width or height of individual columns/rows
• Once the necessary inputs are entered, click on "Edit selected grid"
• GridMod will perform the modification, notify you, and remain open
   ‣ This allows you to perform multiple edits consecutively without having to reopen GridMod
• Supports both mouse and keyboard navigations:
   ‣ "Tab" to go to next input
   ‣ "Shift + Tab" to go to previous input
   ‣ "Arrow" keys on textboxes to increase/decrease by 1
   ‣ "Shift + Arrow" keys on textboxes to increaes/decrease by 10
   ‣ "Enter" or "Shift + M" on "Edit selected grid" to execute the modification

Current Capabilites:
• Supports the following modifications of any GridGen-generated tables:
   ‣ The width or height of all columns/rows
   ‣ The width or height of individual columns/rows
• Persistent UI allowing consecutive executions of various modifications
• Enhanced UI experience with validations and loader

Work-in-Progress:
• Modification of GridGen-generated table headers

Other feature suggestions are welcome!

accepted.name: Stevanus Satria
accepted.description: Tweak . Tune . Tinker

plugins.name: Random Text Generator
plugins.description: A lean plugin that generates randomized text and numbers for multiple layers as effortlessly as possible.This plugin was created with productivity in mind, allowing you to create randomized data for prototypes with just a few keystrokes.How to use itRun the Random Text Generator pluginSelect the text layersWrite the text you want to use, wrapping the randomized data in as described.Choose between Replace text (default) or attach to the beginning or end of the selected text layers.Press return or click the Change text button. Voilà!Example usesCurrency amounts → $[100-999].[10-99]Last online → Last online [1-9][d;hr;m] agoPhone numbers → +1 (800) [100-999]-[1000-9999]Status → [Online;Offline;Away;Do not disturb]Adding emails to a list of names using Append after → @[gmail;hotmail;yahoo;company].comWhat's coming nextFind and replace within the selected layers.Allow faster execution of the plugin, using Parameters through Figma Quick Actions menu: ⌘ /Support or feature requestsFeel free to reach out on Twitter at twitter.com/uxjavi

plugins.name: Time Machine
plugins.description:
Time Machine saves and organizes work that you want to look back on. You'll no longer need to manually copy a version of what you're working on to a new page to reference for later.

Any time you want to save a version, just make a selection and activate Time Machine. It'll send a copy of your selection to a page called "Time Machine" that keeps a chronological timeline of what you've saved.

Your work is organized by date and time, so you can compare side by side as your work evolves.

plugins.name: Codia AI Psd2Figma: Import and Export Photoshop PSD
plugins.description: Fully Editable Figma Layers – Now with Bidirectional PSD SupportThis tool is designed to enhance efficiency, precision, and security when transitioning between Photoshop and Figma. Whether you’re importing PSD files or exporting Figma designs, it offers a seamless and fully editable experience across both platforms.Key Features and Advantages:1. Bidirectional Conversion – PSD ⇄ FigmaEasily import your PSD files into Figma or export your Figma designs back to PSD. This two-way compatibility ensures smooth collaboration between teams using different tools and eliminates the need to manually recreate assets.2. Fully Editable LayersEvery element in your file—whether from Photoshop or Figma—is converted into fully editable layers. Text, shapes, effects, and group structures are preserved with high fidelity, allowing for complete design control in both environments.3. High Compatibility & Pixel-Perfect PrecisionEnjoy near-perfect conversions between Photoshop and Figma. Fonts, blending modes, smart objects, and more are accurately translated, ensuring design consistency and minimal cleanup.4. Fast and Reliable PerformanceExperience rapid file processing with minimal loading times, no matter which direction you’re converting. This boosts productivity and shortens turnaround time for design iterations.5. Privacy and SecurityYour files are securely handled throughout the entire process. Whether importing or exporting, your design data remains protected and private.Why Designers Love It:The Photoshop to Editable Figma Plugin—now with Figma to PSD export—revolutionizes your workflow. Stop wasting time on manual conversions or fixing broken assets. Instead, enjoy fully editable, cross-platform designs with total accuracy and confidence. Ideal for teams collaborating across tools or solo designers switching between platforms, this plugin guarantees smoother handoffs, faster iterations, and more time for creative work.Call to Action☎️For support issues: Slack Twitter Email Codia.AI

plugins.name: Spacing Manager
plugins.description: The PurposeI think we all know that sometimes designers making different spacings between the elements. In some cases, we have 15px spacing, and in another place, 14px. It's hard always to update all these spacings manually.With the help of auto layout, we can resolve this problem. Just turn on the auto layout feature with zero spacing between the elements and use "spacers" between.There are different ways, but I prefer to use the 8-Point Grid System. You can use premade "spacers" from the public library (https://www.figma.com/c/file/809152234949654615/Spacings) and place them between the elements. In that case, you will make sure that the spacings between the components are consistent.How it worksAdd the library https://www.figma.com/c/file/809152234949654615/Spacings or have own symbols that have "$spacing" word in the name;Use them when neededIf you want to hide them, select a parent frame and run the plugin. It will look for all spacers that were used on the frame and will set zero opacityIf you want to show spacers back, just rerun the plugin. If the first spacer on the row will have zero opacity, it will set 100% for all spacers found on the selected frame.Pro tipYou can use smart spacing prediction feature! Here is how it works https://twitter.com/faridsabitov/status/1281697269948067845Pro tipYou can set "cmd"+"option"+"H" hotkey via system preferences in Mac to toggle spacers visibility quickly. You can read more about setting the hotkeys in Figma here: https://hustle.bizongo.in/custom-shortcuts-for-figma-8c93f3bc9ca2
